title: House Panel Probing Capitol Riot Moves to Hold Mark Meadows in Criminal Contempt
sub_head: Onetime chief of staff for Donald Trump has refused to testify before the Jan. 6 committee
body:
WASHINGTON—The House panel investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol said it would move to hold former President Trump’s final chief of staff, Mark Meadows, in criminal contempt of Congress for refusing to testify before the committee.
Mr. Meadows, who was first subpoenaed at the end of September, had been scheduled to appear for a deposition on Wednesday morning. He didn’t show up. Committee Chairman Bennie Thompson (D., Miss.) informed Mr. Meadows’s attorney that the panel would move ahead with contempt charges.
